result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

12:46 PM 22CM31 & 22CM71: Defendant Josiah A. Kaiser in court.  Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Luchsinger does not appear; Def. states that he wishes to fire Atty. Luchsinger and heard on reasons; 12:48pm Atty. Katherine Findley now appears for SPD and notes that Def. does not want SPD to be present; State heard on bond, requests nominal cash; Def. heard, plans to hire own attorney; further discussion on bond; Court orders: $150.00 CASH Bond: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless he has a valid Wisconsin driver's license. Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $100 by next court date ($50/each case). The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes. RD 11/16/22 at 9:00am & JT 12/7/22 at 8:30am in Br. 3

Defendant fails to appear for his jury trial/motion to call of witnesses today.  Atty Luchsinger does not know why his client isn't here.  Attorney Tienstra requests a warrant, court so orders.

12:47 PM Defendant Josiah A. Kaiser in court, in custody with attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (eligible).  Jin Ho D. Pack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Josiah A. Kaiser appeared by video means with Attorney. Discussion on missed appearance.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties.
